case_vignette: Six hours after delivery, a 3050-g (6-lb 12-oz) male newborn is noted to have feeding intolerance and several episodes of bilious vomiting! He was born at term to a healthy 35-year-old woman following a normal vaginal delivery! The pregnancy was uncomplicated, but the patient's mother had missed several of her prenatal checkups! The patient's older brother underwent surgery for pyloric stenosis as an infant! Vital signs are within normal limits! Physical examination shows epicanthus, upward slanting of the eyelids, low-set ears, and a single transverse palmar crease! The lungs are clear to auscultation! A grade 2/6 holosystolic murmur is heard at the left mid to lower sternal border! Abdominal examination shows a distended upper abdomen and a concave-shaped lower abdomen! There is no organomegaly! An x-ray of the abdomen is shown!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing feeding intolerance and have had several episodes of bilious vomiting.
How old are you?
I am a newborn, just six hours old.
Do you have any abdominal swelling or distension?
Yes, my upper abdomen is distended.
Is there any discoloration or a bluish tinge around your belly?
No, there is no discoloration or bluish tinge around my belly.
Have you passed meconium since birth?
The information about whether I have passed meconium since birth is not provided.
Was there any abnormality noted on prenatal ultrasounds?
The case vignette does not provide information about the prenatal ultrasound results.
**Final Diagnosis:** Malrotation with volvulus
